Game.Name: Magical Hat no Buttobi Turbo! Daibouken (Japan)
Game.plot: Overview:DecapAttack was the basis for a long-running comic series in Sonic the Comic (Fleetway). Written and drawn by comic editor Nigel Kitching, it ran for longer than any other Sega game adaptation (aside from Sonic the Hedgehog). It had a particularly dark sense of humor. Given the limited nature of the game, most of the character's personalities were original including the notion that Dr Frank N. Stein is from Wales and his German accent is entirely fake. Most of the characters' names are obvious puns.Cheat: Round SelectIn Options, move the cursor to Exit. Now press right, left, left, right, right, right, left, left, A. The Round Select text appears. Set it to ON, and when you begin a game, the Round Select menu appears.Cheat: Always get extra lives in bonus roundGet all the coins and put them in the following channels and mash C as they reach the top.Cheat: Always get extra lives in bonus roundRound 1: Channel 2Round 2: Channel 5Round 3: Channel 3Round 4: Channel 5Cheat: Always get extra lives in bonus roundJump at one of the white segmented poles in game and land directly on top of it.As you boune on it the segments will turn red and you will get half a heart for each changed segment.
Game.Notes: Magical Hat no Buttobi Turbo! Daibouken (まじかるハットのぶっとびターボ！大冒険) is a 1990 game for the Sega Mega Drive developed by VIC Tokai and published by Sega to tie into Studio Pierrot's Magical Hat anime series. While this game was never released outside Japan, its story, graphics, level layouts, and music were changed into those of Decap Attack.
